intro: Sisymbrium montivagum, commonly known as the mountain mustard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and slender, branched stems. Its leaves are pinnately lobed, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Sisymbrium montivagum is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
